references.paper_title: Gradient flows: in metric spaces and in the space of probability measures
references.reason: This book provides the foundational mathematical framework for understanding gradient flows on the Wasserstein manifold, which is central to the paper's method.
This book is a foundational text on optimal transport theory, which underpins the theoretical framework of Flow Matching, a key component of the proposed method.
This book provides a comprehensive overview of computational methods for optimal transport, which are crucial for practical implementation of the proposed method.
This paper introduces the Flow Matching framework, which is directly extended and adapted in the proposed Meta Flow Matching approach.

references.paper_title: Trellis tree-based analysis reveals stromal regulation of patient-derived organoid drug responses
